name: Unequal
description: in the background there is a piece of Belo Horizonte's map, focusing in the transition between the slums (favela da Serra), east side, and the planned part of town (Centro), at west. The colors represent the native brazilian skin, in brown, and in red and black the natural inks used in their body, the red is from the urucum seed and the black from jenipapo and charcoal. Also, in the east side of the piece, there is the hand of a fallen person, marking the city map.
